pull.title: net: Send post-verack handshake messages at most once
pull.body: There is no need to send `SENDHEADERS` and `SENDCMPCT` messages as a reply to each `VERACK` that is received. For alive checks, a `PING`/`PONG` can be used.

events.message: net: Send post-verack handshake messages at most once

events.body:
Code review ACK fa1f6f237d02265af616129402fa2b8a3019dda5
This is how I'd expected it to work in the first place, so the change imo adheres to the principle of least surprise.

Concept ACK fa1f6f237d02265af616129402fa2b8a3019dda5 this is the only code section that sets `fCurrentlyConnected` and `fSuccessfullyConnected` to true. Could add a test. I did not verify if this code is actually being called repeatedly post initial verack; was it?
ACK fa1f6f237d02265af616129402fa2b8a3019dda5, I have reviewed the code and it looks OK, I agree it can be merged.
Arguably this was a protocol violation, so perhaps we want to backport?
Shouldn't matter much, but I certainly don't mind a backport, as we are doing a release anyway.
Have added this to #20166 for backporting to the 0.20 branch.

issue.title: [0.20] Backports
issue.body:
Backports the following PRs to the 0.20 branch:
* https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/19777 - docs: Correct description for getblockstats's txs field
* https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/19836 - rpc: Properly deserialize txs with witness before signing
* https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/20080 - Strip any trailing `/` in -datadir and -blocksdir paths
* https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/20082 - [bugfix] random: fixes read buffer to use min rather than max
* https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/20141 - Avoid the use of abs64 in timedata
* https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/20146 - net: Send post-verack handshake messages at most once
* https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/20195 - build: fix mutex detection when building bdb on macOS
* https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/20298 - macOS deploy: use the new plistlib API

Will add additional commits as they become available.
